page.title: 15A PERTH COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL
page.content: Each day at{Perth High School}begins with the pupils attending registration at{8.52 a.m.}Teaching then commences for{8 periods,}each of{40 minutes throughout the day. At midday pupils may purchase lunch in the dining halls. Others choose to bring a packed lunch or to go home for their meal. In previous years,{Ordinary & Higher {Grades}have been the major exams. These are now being replaced by the new{Standard Grade system.}At the end of their{2nd year,}pupils must decide what subjects they will study in future years. Both{Mathematics}and {English}are compulsory but students may choose from subjects ranging from History to Computing, Geology to Greek. Education in Scotland is changing dramatically, with a wider range of subjects available as standards rise.
